t: A Song of Ascents, of David.
O*pn Lord,*s my heart is not proud, nor my eyes haughty; Nor*ln do I involve myself in great matters, Or*ln in things too difficult for me.
Surely*ln I have composed and quieted my soul; Like*ln a weaned child rests*i against his mother, My*ln soul is like a weaned child within me.
O*ln Israel, hope in the Lord*s From*ln this time forth and forever.
